snippet: Conceding leadership of the drug fight to Mexico hews to a guiding principle of President Obama’s foreign policy, in which American supremacy is played down, at least publicly.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's conceding leadership of drug fight to Mexico hews to guiding principle of his foreign policy, in which American supremacy is played down, at least publicly; approach runs the risk of being seen as kowtowing to governments more concerned about their public image than underlying problems tarnishing it.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from San José, and Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Conceding leadership of the drug fight to Mexico hews to a guiding principle of President Obama’s foreign policy, in which American supremacy is played down, at least publicly.

headline.main: In Latin America, U.S. Focus Shifts From Drug War to Economy
headline.print_headline: In Latin America, U.S. Focus Shifts From Drug War to Economy
